children.subject:
Thanks for your input and I'm glad Piazza has been helpful. Our peer advisors (I believe we have 6 or 7 this semester) will continue to monitor and answer questions. So you can certainly feel free to continue to post (but FIRST, search previous posts). Also, shout out to Steven Bi who's been amazing at answering student questions! 

Quite frankly imo, Piazza hasn't cut down the number of appointments or emails that we receive, and we just don't have the time to manage all 3.

If it does prove to be the case that we see an increase in appointments or emails, I'm sure we can reconsider going back to Piazza.

So I was also thinking about this. Many of the questions I answer on here are not related to my role. Often, they're not even related to our department. They're questions that I answer through a quick google search. This is something that students should do before posting and not really why Advisers are here.

Tbh not a fan. I get the reasoning but EECS101 Piazza has been by far the most helpful school resource for me in this major and I wish every major did this for questions. Is 5-10 Piazza posts a day really too much? I'm not trying to diminish what you guys do but I just think this hurts everyone -- you'll have to field a lot more appointments and emails while students don't get the benefit of seeing what another person has already asked for any future questions, further increasing load. Anyways, something to consider :/

history.content:
Dear Students:

Beginning Monday, October 2, Piazza will no longer be used for general advising questions. However, we will continue to use this forum for departmental announcements, enrollment updates, and peer-directed correspondence.
This platform has a lot of historical information that continues to be useful. Please use the search function to find quick answers to your questions. Also, use the discussions forum to post questions/comments/recommendations to your peers. Advising staff will not be responding to questions through this forum. 
If you have advising questions, please communicate with the appropriate Undergraduate Major Advisor. Due to the growth of our student body, advising staff will not be responding to posts on Piazza. Please consider one of the following ways to communicate with an advisor.
For LSCS Students:
Refer to the FAQ's page; 
Email cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu*; or, 
Schedule an appointment in Cal Central
For EECS Students:
Email eecs-advising@eecs.berkeley.edu*; 
Schedule an appointment here; or,
Drop by 205 Cory: M-F, 9am-12pm and 1-4pm 
*Note: the standard response time is 3-5 business days.
